area_name: Left Hand of Darkness - E. Face

content.description: This is the thin crack on the summit block just right of the top of Uncle Fester.  Pull the brutal thin moves to get established on real holds, then hang on and climb to the summit.
content.protection: Top rope
content.location: On the upper block just right of Uncle Fester.

content.description: Start in the obvious gully to the left of Uncle Fester (5.3), traverse to the right in the obvious horizontal crack.  Where the crack turns vertical and joins Uncle Fester is the crux.
content.protection: standard
content.location: Start in the obvious gully to the left of Uncle Fester.

climbs.name: Uncle Fester
climbs.fa: Kevin Powell, Randy Vogel, Rob Raker, Darryl Nakahira - May 1983

content.description: The crux lies in the first 10' of climbing with fingerlocks and poor feet.  Eases to 5.8 after that.  Small TCU's will protect down low (purple/blue TCU).  Walk off to the west.
content.protection: Light rack.  Small TCU's (purple/blue) protect the crux.

content.description: Interesting climbing.  Not many of the moves are obvious what to do.
content.protection: Micro cams to 2", small stoppers; gear anchor.
content.location: Start at the same spot as The Right Route, but go straight up the thin cracks instead.  At the large flake, move slightly left, then on top of it -- balancey and cryptic here, and the gear sucks for aways (good idea to plug two pieces under the flake).  Continue up featured face.

climbs.name: To Air Is Human
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger, Eve Laeger, and Rich Perch, Nov. 1987

content.description: This is an exciting arête climb, with fun moves on great rock.  It's scary, but you wouldn't get hurt if you fell at the crux.
content.protection: three bolts plus a few pieces of gear
content.location: on the section of the east face thats close to the road

content.description: Short but varied climbing on sharp stone, with a mantle start,  jams/sidepulls up a fingers-to-fists crack (with good face holds), and a funky crux move around a bulge to the final ramp.
content.protection:
Standard rack to 3 or 4"

Walkoff
content.location:
This route can be found on the East side of Left Hand of Darkness, in the same quiet grotto as Left Route and Right Route. The route is the most obvious line on the face left of and perpendicular to these lines.

From the parking area, walk the clear trail past granny goose, turning right through the boulder field toward the striking vertical face.  Below the face, scramble down and left to the bottom of Stake Your Claim.

climbs.name: Right Route
climbs.fa: Chick Holtkamp and John Lakey 1978, FA Direct: (TR) unknown 1979

content.description:
This is on the separate, left section of the crag.

Start on the right side, move up and left to the crack. Move left at the roof, then up to where moves can be made right, to the crack. Follow it to the top.

The direct route is 5.11c, top rope.
content.protection: Standard Rack.

content.description: This route starts off of a boulder between Bryant Gumbel and Grandpa Gander and features very thin friction moves with very little in the way of holds. Put on your good shoes for this one! As with all routes on this formation, relatively easy walkoff towards entrance road to Lost Horse.
content.protection: This is a three bolt thin friction route. There are no anchors on top. Small to medium pro for anchor. Hexes, Tricams, SLCD's all work well.

content.description: This is a short face climb with no protection.  There is only one 5.6 move.
content.protection: none
content.location: northeast corner of the rock, to the right of Granny Goose

content.description: Follow the splitter on the right facing side of the crag when facing the other routes.  Cut left, sling the chicken head, and then follow the ramp up and to the right.  Top out up the offwidth flake or the face.
content.protection: Gear to 3"

climbs.name: Middle Hand of Darkness
climbs.fa: Unknown, put probably some of the usual suspects in the late 70's

content.description: This route is most likely some sort of old mixed aid line or TR.  There are hammer marks under the roof from pin whacking and I think I remember a pin or two protecting the low crux.  It climbs pretty well with thought provoking moves until the above the roof crux slaps you in the face.  Rock down low is not that great, but gets better as you go.
content.protection: Thin stuff down low, if you can get any, and then sm-med cams for the easy top out.  The anchor takes all sorts of not that great gear from 1/2" to 4".  You will need a long extendo runner to set up a good TR.
content.location: Between Left Hand of Darkness and the Right Hand of Darkness.  Really all this route does is straighten out the Right Hand of Darkness.  Not sure why that thing (RHD) is crawling all over the wall with this direct route available.  Scramble down to climbers right to descend.

climbs.name: Mandarina
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Todd Gordon, and Dave Reinich, September 1996

content.description: Starting at a flake climb the steep face with a small hueco near the top.
content.protection: Gear anchor on top. (to 4 inches)
content.location: The short, steep face of good patina just left of the arete of To Air is Human.

climbs.name: Left Route
climbs.fa: Chick Holtkamp and John Lakey, Feb. 1978

content.description: a poor, runout crack and face route
content.protection: standard rack, but you won't be able to place much gear
content.location: Per the name, this crack climb is on the left side of the section of rock thats set back from the road.

content.description:
The short crack immediately left of Alistair Crowley.

Obviously been done before, but a less grovely alternative to Alistair to get to the top of the formation.
content.location: The short crack immediately left of Alistair Crowley

content.description: Just to the right of the route , Uncle Fester, is a "Y" shaped crack. Jane Pauley is the left side of the Y. Descend off to the left.
content.protection: small to large gear, for the lead and anchors

content.description: This is the obvious offwidth crack on the far right-hand side of the formation which starts in a left-trending undercling/crack until you reach the wider crack that heads straight up. When the crack ends step right to easy friction that will get you to the top. Easy downclimb to the climber's right.
content.protection: This climb accepts a full range of gear, it starts thin about red alien/.5 camalot and widens up top to a #4 camalot.; large cams will suffice for anchors

climbs.name: Grandpa Gander
climbs.fa: Herb Laegar, Andy and Lotus Brown, 10/86

content.description: This is the first route to the left of Granny Goose. Pull onto the face above an overlap and make thin moves up past three bolts. Some pro can be had past the last bolt to ease your mind. Easy descent down the north face (towards the Lost Horse Road).
content.protection: 3 bolts, pro to 3" for anchors

content.description:
Start atop a boulder between Granny Goose and Grandpa Gander.

Climb up the face to a left facing flake, then up to a thin, vertical seam. Face climb up along the seam (crux) to a horizontal crack. Continue up another short seam to the top.
content.protection: Anchor rope and cams needed to set up a TR.
content.location: Start atop a boulder between Granny Goose and Grandpa Gander.

content.description:
Scramble up and right of the start of Granny Goose and Mother Goose to the base of a squeeze chimney. This chimney is just right of the Mother Goose arête.

Squirm up the chimney and short hand crack to the terrace.
content.protection: Large gear to protect the chimney, anchor material needed to set up a TR.
content.location: Scramble up and right of the start of Granny Goose and Mother Goose to the base of a squeeze chimney.

content.description: This route breaks off to the right of "Jane Pauly" approximately 12-15' up the crack; it's an obvious line to the top. A relatively easy walk off is necessary (or leave your pro for me to get later).
content.protection: Standard Rack, no anchors

content.description:
Brew 102 follows a crack/corner to the left of "Left Route".

It was also a famous cheap beer brewed in L.A.
content.protection: Standard rack.

pathTokens: Left Hand of Darkness - E. Face
